alert.note: Alert for Polk; St. Croix (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 8:22PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Washington, northwestern St. Croix and south central Polk Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 822 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stillwater, or 18 miles northeast of St. Paul, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Somerset around 840 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include New Richmond and Star Prairie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northwestern and west central Wisconsin.
